definition: to round up to the nearest integer/to discard four, but treat five as whole (of decimal points)
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The figures in the table are rounded to the nearest ton.
sentences.chinese: 表中的数字四舍五入到最接近的整吨数。

sentences.english: The dutiable value shall be rounded off to RMB fen.
sentences.chinese: 完税价格采用四舍五入法计算至分。

sentences.english: Round each measurement to the nearest whole inch or centimetre.
sentences.chinese: 将每个测量数目四舍五入到最近的英寸或厘米整数。

sentences.english: All figures should be rounded down to the nearest penny.
sentences.chinese: 所有数字应四舍五入到最接近的一分钱。

sentences.english: Then see which ten a number is closer to.
sentences.chinese: 然后再看哪一个十位数最接近你要四舍五入的数字。

sentences.english: If the one'sdigitis less than 5, round to thelesserten.
sentences.chinese: 如果数字低于5，则四舍五入到较小的十位数。

sentences.english: Rounding it off to the nearest whole number gives you two.
sentences.chinese: 四舍五入到最接近的整数是2。

definition: to convert/conversion/(in accounting, referring to currency conversion) translation
small figure/small amount/the part of a number to the right of the decimal point (or radix point)/fractional part of a number/number between 0 and 1/decimal fraction
